findings.title: Flashloan Attack
findings.description: N/A

findings.title: Token Supply Manipulation
findings.description: Tokens can be minted only according to rules specified in a whitepaper or any other documentation provided by the Customer.

findings.title: Gas Limit and Loops
findings.description: N/A

findings.title: Solidity Style Guide Violation
findings.description: Order Of Layout and Naming Convention violations

findings.title: Requirements Compliance
findings.description: Gaps in functional requirements and limited technical description.

findings.title: Environment Consistency
findings.description: Smart contract data should be consistent all over the data flow.

findings.title: Secure Oracles Usage
findings.description: The code should have the ability to pause specific data feeds that it relies on. This should be done to protect a contract from compromised oracles.

findings.title: Tests Coverage
findings.description: The project has an approximate branch coverage of 80%. However, there are issues with running tests due to compilation errors within the test contract 'out of the box'. Additionally, some functions that might change key system parameters lack coverage.

findings.title: H01. Unbounded Parameter Values
findings.description: The system lacks limits on key parameters such as fees in its initial configuration and setter function, allowing for unbounded values.

findings.title: M01. Missing Events on Critical State Updates
findings.description: Critical state changes should emit events for tracking things off-chain.

findings.title: L01. Missing Validation
findings.description: Require statements should have their error message described consciously in order to advise the user about the transaction failure.
findings.function: notifyWithdraw(), velocore__execute(), velocore__bribe(), underlyingTokens(), setParam(), constructor(); balanceOf(), totalSupply(), symbol(), decimals(), transferFrom(), safeTransferFrom(); deploy(), setFee;

findings.title: L02. Missing Require Error Messages
findings.description: Require statements should have their error message described consciously in order to advise the user about the transaction failure.

findings.title: L03. Missing Zero Address Validation
findings.description: Address parameters are being used without checking against the possibility of 0x0.

findings.title: L04. Contradiction
findings.description: N/A

findings.title: I01. Floating Pragma
findings.description: The project uses floating pragmas ^0.8.0 or ^0.8.19, which may result in contracts being deployed using the wrong pragma version, different from the one they were tested with.

findings.title: I02. Missing Variable Explicit Visibility
findings.description: Functions and state variables visibility should be set explicitly.

findings.title: I03. Solidity Style Guide Violation: Order Of Layout
findings.description: Inside each contract, library or interface, use the following order of layout as per Official Style Guide.

findings.title: I04. Solidity Style Guide Violation: Naming Convention
findings.description: Functions, local and state variable names should be mixedCase: capitalize all the letters of the initialisms, except keep the first one lower case if it is the beginning of the name.

findings.title: I05. Unused Function Parameter
findings.description: The parameter gauge from the function bribeTokens() is not being used, resulting in higher Gas consumption, bad developer experience and readability issues.

findings.title: I06. Test Compilation Error
findings.description: It is impossible to build the test contracts “out of the box” or measure coverage due to the compilation error.
